Deficiency Narrative: 4 staff files reviewed did not have current trainings. 5 children's files reviewed did not have required documentation.
Correction Narrative: It was discussed that anytime Embracing Destiny GRO staff is having issues with logging into the portal to complete the DFPS required trainings or to print out training certificates with a date on them, that individual should email or call IT as follow up to show that you are attempting to resolve this issue. The email or documentation of the phone call made to IT should be saved and filed accordingly in the staff records, as well as you can also escalate the IT ticket to your RCM while the issue is being resolved.

Deficiency Narrative: 6 children's files reviewed were not accurate as they did not have required documentation as far as 2403.
Correction Narrative: It was discussed that after December 6, 2024 the Form 2403 is no longer needed to document Medical, Dental, and Behavioral Health visits. Embracing Destiny has opted to continue to use the Form 2403 as documentation that the visit has been done and they agreed to complete the form in its entirety.

Deficiency Narrative: Two of six child files reviewed did not have documentation to support the implementation of the CANS Assessment recommendation.
Correction Narrative: It was discussed that referrals to the Developmental Disability Specialist must be made if this is a recommendation on the childs CANS Assessment. The operation agreed to include a copy of the email requesting that the referral be completed as well as a copy of the referral will be filed in the childs record.

Deficiency Narrative: There were no staff initials documented in the Medication Administration Record.
Correction Narrative:
A corrective action plan was created and effective immediately, the supervisor on shift will ensure that all required signatures and initials are documented in the Medication Administration Record. The MARs will be checked daily following the administration of the medications to the children.
These will be checked for each shift and staff who administers and records each time the medication is given to the clients.
If for some reason the supervisor is unable to perform this duty, the facility manger will be next in line to review these documents to ensure all required signatures and initials are in place.

Deficiency Narrative: The restraint conducted was taken to the ground.
Correction Narrative:
The agency sent, "implemented immediately, no resident will be placed in a prone or supine restraint at any time. Containment positions used by Embracing Destiny will be the Hug containment/Escort and assist to ground from Elbow-to Hip containment. The agency was asked to clarify how this will be implemented or had been implemented since being cited. to complete the compliance.
5.24.24-"They will receive this training twice a year."

Deficiency Narrative: A review of the file of a staff authorized to transport children showed that the staff only had 0.15 hours of transportation training.
Correction Narrative:
Training on transportation were updated for all staff in both RTC and GRO.
Certificates as well as the training attendance are uploaded in Sharepoint.

Deficiency Narrative: A child resident was not administered his prescribed medicine on time (AM medicine).
Correction Narrative: Staff concerned on administering medicine was given a re-orientation on timely administration of medicines.

Deficiency Narrative: While reviewing the serious incident report it was found the physical address and telephone was not listed on the report.
Correction Narrative:
On 06/29/22, compliance plan was received from operation with the following corrections:

The Serious Incident Report Form was update to include the physical address and telephone number. Copy was provided and located in Share Point.

Deficiency Narrative: While reviewing the EBI report it was found that the de-escalation during the use of EBI was not listed. 748.2855(a)(10)-attempts to explain to the child what was necessary for release from intervention was not listed on the report. 748.2855(a)(12)- the action the caregiver took to facilitate the child's return to normal activities was not listed on the report.
Correction Narrative:
On06/29/22, compliance plan received by email with the following corrections:

All EDF employee will be retrained on documentation of a physical restraint which will include: 
        
Behavior necessary for release         

Action the caregiver took to facilitate the childs return to the milieu

Operation also provided copy of restraint report they will utilize and this is located in Share Point.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation does not currently have a summary log for unauthorized absences.
Correction Narrative:
On 06/29/22, compliance plan was received by email with the following corrections:

As of June 15, 2022 Embracing Destiny Foundation GRO has created and will keep a summary log for unauthorized absences of all residents.  Copy of log was provided and located in share point.

Deficiency Narrative: While reviewing the Children's rights the right to seek employment was missing from the document. 748.1101(4)(d)(C)-Confidential care was missing however the part regarding keeping medical records and operation records private was not  listed. 748.1101(5)(b)- Ombudsman and Youth currently in foster Care was not listed on the children's right document.
Correction Narrative:
On 06/29/22, compliance plan received by email with the following corrections:

Effective immediately upon admission all resident will be given a CPS Rights of  Children and Youth in Foster Care (Form K-908-2530) to sign. These rights will also be explain to each youth.

Deficiency Narrative: While reviewing staff record the, Notarized Licensing Affidavit for Applicants for Employment form was not not found in the staff record.
Correction Narrative:
On 06/29/22, compliance plan was received by email with the following corrections:

Effective immediately, the office manager will ensure that all new hire paperwork is completed, signed and notarized before the employee is put on the schedule.

Deficiency Narrative: It was determined that the children in care are not allowed to have individualized hair cuts.  Children are not provided with the normalcy, when they are not given a choice on their personal care  and this is causing emotional distress.
Correction Narrative:
Email received from the agency.
Corrective Action Implemented:
	Implemented immediately all clients will be allow to get the hair cut of their choice. Any client not wanting a hair cuts will also have that option.

Deficiency Narrative: It was determined that some residents were not administered their medication as prescribed by the doctor for over 30 days.
Correction Narrative: 	Effective immediately all medication will be administered per the doctor orders, all refills will be requested a week in advance to ensure the client does not run out of medications. Medication will be Q & A after AM doses and PM doses.
